comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think this woman may be misidentified, and is Mrs. William Kinnicutt Draper (wife to a famous New York society doctor), born Helen Fidelia Hoffman. She was a leader of the American Red Cross. This photo later in the Bain stream, identified as Mrs. H. Kinnicutt, looks like the same woman to me. Mrs. W.K. Draper was an organizer of the Red Cross Tea Room at the International Flower Show in New York in March, 1915. On different days of the show, the servers and hosts were dressed in the national garb of the embattled countries of Europe, which accounts for the photos of the women in various costumes.
